definition: to rush/to charge/to dash/to break through/to temper oneself (through battling hardships)
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: They say, 'we can get through this one step at a time.'
sentences.chinese: 而会说这一次我们一定能闯过难关的。

sentences.english: Like they jump the red light and then hit you.
sentences.chinese: 就像他们闯过红灯，把你撞了。

sentences.english: It's queer that he managed to bluff his way through all the difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 很奇怪他居然设法招摇撞骗闯过所有难关。

sentences.english: A narrow victory in the House is not necessarily a harbinger of success in the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 议案能够小取众院并不意味着也能闯过参议院这一关。

sentences.english: B:  If we pull this off, we'll all get promotions.
sentences.chinese: 若我们闯过这一关，我们就升官了。

sentences.english: They ran a blockade and got to the border.
sentences.chinese: 他们闯过封锁线来到边境地区。

definition: checkpoint (for taxation, security etc)/barrier/hurdle/red tape/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]
nine deaths and still alive (idiom); a narrow escape/new lease of life
to be more scared than hurt (idiom)/to get through a daunting experience without mishap
to cross a barrier/to get through (an ordeal)/to pass (a test)/to reach (a standard)
